intro: Centaurea elegantissima var. albiflora, commonly known as the whiteflowered knapweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the Mediterranean region. It features upright, branched stems that are covered in soft, hairy foliage. The plant produces showy, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center, blooming from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a slightly serrated edge, contributing to its ornamental appeal. This variety is valued in gardens for its ability to thrive in well-drained soils and its ability to attract pollinators.
